summary: The Freedom to Move Act (H.R. 4719) proposes a grant program administered by the Secretary of Transportation to support fare-free public transit initiatives. The bill aims to facilitate the implementation of fare-free programs, enhance public transportation—particularly in underserved areas—and includes provisions for bus network redesigns, community engagement, equity evaluations, and reporting requirements. Eligible entities include states, counties, municipalities, transit agencies, and non-profits. The bill authorizes $5 billion annually from 2026-2030.
